intro: Erigeron spinulosus, commonly known as the spinulose fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils. It produces showy yellow flowers that are surrounded by white ray florets, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its hairy, spinulose leaves are a distinguishing feature, contributing to its adaptability in arid environments.
